chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy A. Matzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 1.   Cash bond applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 2.  Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a minimum 250 word apology letter to Officer Gray. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1. Stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy A. Matzke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy A. Matzke in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 2 to Misd. Battery, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1 as charged and amended Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Ct. 1 as charged and amended Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Defendant Jeremy A. Matzke in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Jeremy A. Matzke in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Gerbers requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff.

No contact direct or indirect with Officer Gray unless it's in an official capacity.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Jeremy A. Matzke appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
